title: Authors and Citation
text: Li X, Meng X, Chen H, et al. Integration single sample population analysis understanding immune evasion mechanisms lung cancer. NPJ Syst Biol Appl. 2023;9(1):4. Hazimeh, Hussein et al. “L0Learn: Scalable Package Sparse Learning using L0 Regularization.” J. Mach. Learn. Res. 24 (2022): 205:1-205:8. Hazimeh, Hussein Rahul Mazumder. “Fast Best Subset Selection: Coordinate Descent Local Combinatorial Optimization Algorithms.” Oper. Res. 68 (2018): 1517-1537.

title: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network
text: inferCSN R package inferring Cell-Specific gene regulatory Network single-cell RNA data.

title: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network
text: can install released version CRAN use: can install development version GitHub use pak:
code: install.packages("inferCSN") # or if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") } pak::pak("inferCSN") if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") } pak::pak("mengxu98/inferCSN")

title: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network
code: library(inferCSN) data(example_matrix)  network <- inferCSN(   example_matrix )

title: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network
text: use inferCSN work, please cite reference .

title: Calculate Accuracy — calculate_accuracy
code: calculate_accuracy(network_table, ground_truth)

title: Calculate Accuracy — calculate_accuracy
text: network_table data frame predicted network structure ground_truth data frame ground truth network

title: Calculate Accuracy — calculate_accuracy
code: data(example_matrix) data("example_ground_truth") network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Using 1 core #> ⠙ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Running [1/18] ETA:  2s #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Completed 18 tasks in 371ms #>  #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:48] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Run done. calculate_accuracy(   network_table,   example_ground_truth ) #> $metrics #>   Metric Value #> 1    ACC 0.948 #>

title: Calculate AUC Metrics — calculate_auc
text: Calculates AUROC AUPRC metrics optional visualization

title: Calculate AUC Metrics — calculate_auc
code: calculate_auc(   network_table,   ground_truth,   return_plot = FALSE,   line_color = "#1563cc",   line_width = 1,   tag_levels = "A" )

title: Calculate AUC Metrics — calculate_auc
text: network_table data frame predicted network structure ground_truth data frame ground truth network return_plot Logical value indicating whether generate plots line_color Color plot lines line_width Width plot lines tag_levels Tag levels plot annotations

title: Calculate AUC Metrics — calculate_auc
code: data(example_matrix) data("example_ground_truth") network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:36:49] Run done. calculate_auc(   network_table,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) #> $metrics #>   Metric Value #> 1  AUROC 0.952 #> 2  AUPRC 0.437 #>  #> $plot  #>

what: Rank TFs and genes in network — calculate_gene_rank
title: Rank TFs and genes in network — calculate_gene_rank
Rank TFs and genes in network — calculate_gene_rank
code: calculate_gene_rank(   network_table,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   directed = FALSE )

title: Rank TFs and genes in network — calculate_gene_rank
text: network_table weight data table network. regulators Regulators list. targets Targets list. directed Whether network directed.

title: Rank TFs and genes in network — calculate_gene_rank
Rank TFs and genes in network — calculate_gene_rank
code: data(example_matrix) network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:54] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:36:54] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:54] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:54] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:54] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:36:55] Run done. head(calculate_gene_rank(network_table)) #>   gene rank_value regulator #> 1  g18 0.05883983      TRUE #> 2  g17 0.05873281      TRUE #> 3   g9 0.05869090      TRUE #> 4   g5 0.05863236      TRUE #> 5   g7 0.05811175      TRUE #> 6   g6 0.05756879      TRUE head(calculate_gene_rank(network_table, regulators = "g1")) #>   gene rank_value regulator #> 1   g1 0.46396396      TRUE #> 2   g2 0.18784178     FALSE #> 3  g18 0.13390621     FALSE #> 4  g17 0.02111819     FALSE #> 5   g5 0.02038973     FALSE #> 6   g9 0.01973099     FALSE head(calculate_gene_rank(network_table, targets = "g1")) #>   gene rank_value regulator #> 1   g1 0.46396396     FALSE #> 2  g18 0.22091630      TRUE #> 3   g2 0.09045695      TRUE #> 4  g17 0.03444956      TRUE #> 5   g9 0.01902045      TRUE #> 6  g16 0.01740632      TRUE

what: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
text: Calculates comprehensive performance metrics evaluating predicted network structures, including classification performance, precision-recall metrics, network topology metrics.

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
code: calculate_metrics(   network_table,   ground_truth,   metric_type = c("all", "auc", "auroc", "auprc", "precision", "recall", "f1",     "accuracy", "si", "ji"),   return_plot = FALSE,   line_color = "#1563cc",   line_width = 1 )

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
text: network_table data frame. ground_truth data frame ground truth network format network_table. metric_type type metric return. Default "". can take following choices: Returns available metrics Performance Metrics plot. auc Returns AUROC AUPRC plots. auroc Area ROC Curve plot. auprc Area Precision-Recall Curve plot. precision Proportion correct predictions among positive predictions. recall Proportion actual positives correctly identified. f1 Harmonic mean precision recall. accuracy Overall classification accuracy. si Set Intersection, counting correctly predicted edges. ji Jaccard Index, measuring overlap predicted true networks. return_plot Whether generate visualization plots. Default FALSE. line_color Color plot lines. Default #1563cc. line_width Width plot lines. Default 1.

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
text: list containing: metrics data frame requested metrics. plot plot object return_plot = TRUE (optional).

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
code: data(example_matrix) data("example_ground_truth") network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:56] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:36:56] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:56] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:56] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:36:56] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:36:56] Run done. calculate_metrics(   network_table,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) #> $metrics #>      Metric  Value #> 1     AUROC  0.952 #> 2     AUPRC  0.437 #> 3 Precision  0.529 #> 4    Recall  1.000 #> 5        F1  0.692 #> 6       ACC  0.948 #> 7        JI  0.514 #> 8        SI 18.000 #>  #> $plot  #>  calculate_metrics(   network_table,   example_ground_truth,   metric_type = "auroc" ) #> $metrics #>   Metric Value #> 1  AUROC 0.952 #>

title: Sparse regression model — fit_srm
code: fit_srm(   x,   y,   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   penalty = "L0",   regulators_num = ncol(x),   n_folds = 5,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Sparse regression model — fit_srm
text: x matrix regulators. y vector target. cross_validation Whether use cross-validation. Default FALSE. seed random seed cross-validation. Default 1. penalty type regularization, default "L0". can take either one following choices: "L0", "L0L1", "L0L2". high-dimensional sparse data, "L0L2" effective. regulators_num number regulators target. n_folds number folds cross-validation. Default 5. verbose Whether print progress messages. Default TRUE. ... Parameters methods.

title: Sparse regression model — fit_srm
text: list sparse regression model. list three components: model, metrics, coefficients.

what: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network — inferCSN-package
title: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network — inferCSN-package
text: R package inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network single-cell RNA-seq data.

title: Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network — inferCSN-package
Inferring Cell-Specific Gene Regulatory Network — inferCSN-package

what: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
title: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
text: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network

title: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
code: inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'matrix' inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'sparseMatrix' inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'data.frame' inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
text: object input data inferCSN. penalty type regularization, default "L0". can take either one following choices: "L0", "L0L1", "L0L2". high-dimensional sparse data, "L0L2" effective. cross_validation Whether use cross-validation. Default FALSE. seed random seed cross-validation. Default 1. n_folds number folds cross-validation. Default 5. subsampling_method method use subsampling. Options "sample", "pseudobulk" "meta_cells". subsampling_ratio percent samples used fit_srm. Default 1. r_squared_threshold Threshold \(R^2\) coefficient. Default 0. regulators regulator genes infer regulatory network. targets target genes infer regulatory network. cores number cores use parallelization foreach::foreach. Default 1. verbose Whether print progress messages. Default TRUE. ... Parameters methods.

title: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
text: data table regulator-target regulatory relationships. data table three columns: regulator, target, weight.

title: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
code: data(example_matrix) network_table_1 <- inferCSN(   example_matrix ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Using 1 core #> ⠙ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Running [1/18] ETA:  0s #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Completed 18 tasks in 310ms #>  #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:00] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Run done.  network_table_2 <- inferCSN(   example_matrix,   cores = 2 ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using 2 cores #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Run done.  head(network_table_1) #>   regulator target     weight #> 1       g18     g1 -0.9223177 #> 2       g17    g18  0.8770468 #> 3        g4     g3  0.8103230 #> 4       g16    g15  0.7659245 #> 5       g17    g16  0.7558764 #> 6       g12    g11  0.7444053  identical(   network_table_1,   network_table_2 ) #> [1] TRUE  inferCSN(   example_matrix,   regulators = c("g1", "g2"),   targets = c("g3", "g4") ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using 2 regulators #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using 2 targets #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Run done. #>   regulator target     weight #> 1        g2     g3  0.9848781 #> 2        g2     g4  0.9230387 #> 3        g1     g4 -0.3847071 #> 4        g1     g3 -0.1732490 inferCSN(   example_matrix,   regulators = c("g1", "g2"),   targets = c("g3", "g0") ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using 2 regulators #> ! [2025-10-15 10:37:01] 1 out of 2 candidate targets are in the input matrix #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:01] Run done. #>   regulator target     weight #> 1        g2     g3  0.9848781 #> 2        g1     g3 -0.1732490  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("example_ground_truth") network_table_07 <- inferCSN(   example_matrix,   r_squared_threshold = 0.7 ) calculate_metrics(   network_table_1,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) calculate_metrics(   network_table_07,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(example_matrix) network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) head(network_table)  network_table_sparse_1 <- inferCSN(   as(example_matrix, "sparseMatrix") ) head(network_table_sparse_1)  network_table_sparse_2 <- inferCSN(   as(example_matrix, "sparseMatrix"),   cores = 2 ) identical(   network_table,   network_table_sparse_1 )  identical(   network_table_sparse_1,   network_table_sparse_2 )  plot_scatter(   data.frame(     network_table$weight,     network_table_sparse_1$weight   ),   legend_position = "none" )  plot_weight_distribution(   network_table ) + plot_weight_distribution(   network_table_sparse_1 ) } # }

code: infercsn_logo(unicode = cli::is_utf8_output())

title: The logo of inferCSN — infercsn_logo
text: unicode Unicode symbols UTF-8 platforms. Default cli::is_utf8_output.

what: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
text: function detects metacells single-cell gene expression matrix using dimensionality reduction clustering techniques.

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
code: meta_cells(   matrix,   genes_use = NULL,   genes_exclude = NULL,   var_genes_num = min(1000, nrow(matrix)),   gamma = 10,   knn_k = 5,   do_scale = TRUE,   pc_num = 25,   fast_pca = FALSE,   do_approx = FALSE,   approx_num = 20000,   directed = FALSE,   use_nn2 = TRUE,   seed = 1,   cluster_method = "walktrap",   block_size = 10000,   weights = NULL,   do_median_norm = FALSE,   ... )

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
text: matrix gene expression matrix rows represent genes columns represent cells. genes_use character vector specifying genes used PCA dimensionality reduction. Default NULL. genes_exclude character vector specifying genes excluded PCA computation. Default NULL. var_genes_num Number variable genes select genes_use provided. Default min(1000, nrow(matrix)). gamma Default 10. Coarse-graining parameter defining target ratio input cells output metacells (e.g., gamma=10 yields approximately n/10 metacells n input cells). knn_k Default 5. Number nearest neighbors constructing cell-cell similarity network. do_scale Whether standardize (center scale) gene expression values PCA. Default TRUE. pc_num Default 25. Number principal components retain downstream analysis. fast_pca Default TRUE. Whether use faster irlba algorithm instead standard PCA. Recommended large datasets. do_approx Default FALSE. Whether use approximate nearest neighbor search datasets >50000 cells improve computational efficiency. approx_num Default 20000. Number cells randomly sample approximate nearest neighbor computation do_approx = TRUE. directed Default FALSE. Whether construct directed undirected nearest neighbor graph. use_nn2 Default TRUE. Whether use faster RANN::nn2 algorithm nearest neighbor search (applicable Euclidean distance). seed Default 1. Random seed reproducibility subsampling cells approximate mode. cluster_method Default walktrap. Algorithm community detection cell similarity network. Options: walktrap (recommended) louvain (gamma parameter ignored). block_size Default 10000. Number cells process batch mapping cells metacells approximate mode. Adjust based available memory. weights Default NULL. Numeric vector cell-specific weights weighted averaging computing metacell expression profiles. Length must match number cells. do_median_norm Default FALSE. Whether perform median-based normalization final metacell expression matrix. ... Additional arguments passed internal functions.

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
text: matrix rows represent metacells columns represent genes.

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells

Format network table — network_format
code: network_format(   network_table,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   abs_weight = TRUE )

title: Format network table — network_format
text: network_table weight data table network. regulators Regulators list. targets Targets list. abs_weight Logical value, default TRUE, whether perform absolute value weights, set abs_weight TRUE, output weight table create new column named Interaction.

title: Sifting network — network_sift
code: network_sift(   network_table,   matrix = NULL,   meta_data = NULL,   pseudotime_column = NULL,   method = c("entropy", "max"),   entropy_method = c("Shannon", "Renyi"),   effective_entropy = FALSE,   shuffles = 100,   entropy_nboot = 300,   lag_value = 1,   entropy_p_value = 0.05,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Sifting network — network_sift
text: network_table weight data table network. matrix expression matrix. meta_data meta data cells samples. pseudotime_column column pseudotime. method method used filter edges. choose "entropy" "max". entropy_method setting method "entropy", choose "Shannon" "Renyi" compute entropy. effective_entropy Default FALSE. Whether use effective entropy filter weights. shuffles Default 100. number shuffles used calculate effective transfer entropy. entropy_nboot Default 300. number bootstrap replications direction estimated transfer entropy. lag_value Default 1. Markov order gene expression values, .e. number lagged values affecting current value gene expression values. entropy_p_value P value used filter edges entropy. Default 0.05. cores number cores use parallelization foreach::foreach. Default 1. verbose Whether print progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Sifting network — network_sift
text: data table regulator-target regulatory relationships. data table three columns: regulator, target, weight.

title: Sifting network — network_sift
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(example_matrix) data(example_meta_data) data(example_ground_truth)  network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) network_table_sifted <- network_sift(network_table) network_table_sifted_entropy <- network_sift(   network_table,   matrix = example_matrix,   meta_data = example_meta_data,   pseudotime_column = "pseudotime",   lag_value = 2,   shuffles = 0,   entropy_nboot = 0 )  plot_network_heatmap(   example_ground_truth[, 1:3],   heatmap_title = "Ground truth",   show_names = TRUE,   rect_color = "gray70" ) plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   heatmap_title = "Raw",   show_names = TRUE,   rect_color = "gray70" ) plot_network_heatmap(   network_table_sifted,   heatmap_title = "Filtered",   show_names = TRUE,   rect_color = "gray70" ) plot_network_heatmap(   network_table_sifted_entropy,   heatmap_title = "Filtered by entropy",   show_names = TRUE,   rect_color = "gray70" )  calculate_metrics(   network_table,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) calculate_metrics(   network_table_sifted,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) calculate_metrics(   network_table_sifted_entropy,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) } # }

title: Plot coefficients — plot_coefficient
code: plot_coefficient(   data,   style = "continuous",   positive_color = "#3d67a2",   negative_color = "#c82926",   neutral_color = "#cccccc",   bar_width = 0.7,   text_size = 3,   show_values = TRUE )

title: Plot coefficients — plot_coefficient
text: data Input data. style Plotting style: "binary", "gradient", "continuous". positive_color Color positive weights. Default "#3d67a2". negative_color Color negative weights. Default "#c82926". neutral_color Color weights near zero (used "continuous" style). Default "#cccccc". bar_width Width bars. Default 0.7. text_size Size text weight values. Default 3. show_values Whether show weight values bars. Default TRUE.

title: Plot coefficients — plot_coefficient
code: data(example_matrix) network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix, targets = "g1") #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Using 1 target #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:05] Run done. plot_coefficient(network_table)  plot_coefficient(network_table, style = "binary")

title: Plot dynamic networks — plot_dynamic_networks
code: plot_dynamic_networks(   network_table,   celltypes_order,   ntop = 10,   title = NULL,   theme_type = "theme_void",   plot_type = "ggplot",   layout = "fruchtermanreingold",   nrow = 2,   figure_save = FALSE,   figure_name = NULL,   figure_width = 6,   figure_height = 6,   seed = 1 )

title: Plot dynamic networks — plot_dynamic_networks
text: network_table weight data table network. celltypes_order order cell types. ntop number top genes plot. Default 10. title title figure. Default NULL. theme_type theme figure. "theme_void", "theme_blank", "theme_facet". Default "theme_void". plot_type type figure. "ggplot", "animate", "ggplotly". Default "ggplot". layout layout figure. "fruchtermanreingold" "kamadakawai". Default "fruchtermanreingold". nrow number rows figure. Default 2. figure_save Whether save figure file. Default FALSE. figure_name name figure file. Default NULL. figure_width width figure. Default 6. figure_height height figure. Default 6. seed seed random use plot network. Default 1.

title: Plot histogram — plot_histogram
text: data numeric vector. binwidth Width bins. show_border Logical value, whether show border bins. border_color Color border. alpha Alpha value bins. theme Theme bins. theme_begin Begin value theme. theme_end End value theme. theme_direction Direction theme. legend_position position legend.

title: Plot network heatmap — plot_network_heatmap
code: plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   switch_matrix = TRUE,   show_names = FALSE,   heatmap_size_lock = TRUE,   heatmap_size = 5,   heatmap_height = NULL,   heatmap_width = NULL,   heatmap_title = NULL,   heatmap_color = c("#1966ad", "white", "#bb141a"),   border_color = "gray",   rect_color = NA,   anno_width = 1,   anno_height = 1,   row_anno_type = c("boxplot", "barplot", "histogram", "density", "lines", "points",     "horizon"),   column_anno_type = c("boxplot", "barplot", "histogram", "density", "lines", "points"),   legend_name = "Weight",   row_title = "Regulators" )

title: Plot network heatmap — plot_network_heatmap
text: network_table weight data table network. regulators Regulators list. targets Targets list. switch_matrix Whether weight data table matrix. Default TRUE. show_names Whether show names row column. Default FALSE. heatmap_size_lock Lock size heatmap. heatmap_size size heatmap. Default 5. heatmap_height height heatmap. heatmap_width width heatmap. heatmap_title title heatmap. heatmap_color Colors heatmap. border_color Default "gray". Color heatmap border. rect_color Default NA. Color heatmap rect. anno_width Width annotation. anno_height Height annotation. row_anno_type Default "boxplot", add annotation plot row. choose one "boxplot", "barplot", "histogram", "density", "lines", "points", "horizon". column_anno_type Default "boxplot", add annotation plot column. choose one "boxplot", "barplot", "histogram", "density", "lines", "points". legend_name name legend. row_title title row.

title: Plot network heatmap — plot_network_heatmap
code: data(example_matrix) data("example_ground_truth") network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:20] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:20] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:20] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:20] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:20] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:20] Run done.  p1 <- plot_network_heatmap(   example_ground_truth[, 1:3],   heatmap_title = "Ground truth",   legend_name = "Ground truth" ) p2 <- plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   heatmap_title = "inferCSN",   legend_name = "inferCSN" ) ComplexHeatmap::draw(p1 + p2)  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ p3 <- plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   legend_name = "Weight1",   heatmap_color = c("#20a485", "#410054", "#fee81f") ) p4 <- plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   legend_name = "Weight2",   heatmap_color = c("#20a485", "white", "#fee81f") ) ComplexHeatmap::draw(p3 + p4) } # }  plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   show_names = TRUE,   rect_color = "gray90",   row_anno_type = "density",   column_anno_type = "barplot" )   plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   regulators = c("g1", "g3", "g5"),   targets = c("g3", "g6", "g9"),   show_names = TRUE )  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   regulators = c("g1", "g2"),   show_names = TRUE )  plot_network_heatmap(   network_table,   targets = c("g1", "g2"),   row_anno_type = "boxplot",   column_anno_type = "histogram",   show_names = TRUE ) } # }

what: Plot expression data in a scatter plot — plot_scatter

Plot expression data in a scatter plot — plot_scatter
code: plot_scatter(   data,   smoothing_method = "lm",   group_colors = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(9, "Set1"),   title_color = "black",   title = NULL,   col_title = NULL,   row_title = NULL,   legend_title = NULL,   legend_position = "bottom",   margins = "both",   marginal_type = NULL,   margins_size = 10,   compute_correlation = TRUE,   compute_correlation_method = "pearson",   keep_aspect_ratio = TRUE,   facet = FALSE,   se = FALSE,   pointdensity = TRUE )

title: Plot expression data in a scatter plot — plot_scatter
text: data Input data. smoothing_method Method smoothing curve, lm loess. group_colors Colors different groups. title_color Color title. title Main title plot. col_title Title x-axis. row_title Title y-axis. legend_title Title legend. legend_position position legend. margins position marginal figure ("", "x", "y"). marginal_type type marginal figure (density, histogram, boxplot, violin, densigram). margins_size size marginal figure, note bigger size smaller figure. compute_correlation Whether compute print correlation figure. compute_correlation_method Method compute correlation (pearson spearman). keep_aspect_ratio Logical value, whether set aspect ratio 1:1. facet Faceting variable. setting TRUE, settings margins inalidation. se Display confidence interval around smooth. pointdensity Plot point density provide 1 cluster.

title: Plot expression data in a scatter plot — plot_scatter
Plot expression data in a scatter plot — plot_scatter
code: data(example_matrix) test_data <- data.frame(   example_matrix[1:200, c(1, 7)],   c = c(     rep("c1", 40),     rep("c2", 40),     rep("c3", 40),     rep("c4", 40),     rep("c5", 40)   ) )  p1 <- plot_scatter(   test_data ) p2 <- plot_scatter(   test_data,   marginal_type = "boxplot" ) p1 + p2   p3 <- plot_scatter(   test_data,   facet = TRUE ) p3  p4 <- plot_scatter(   test_data[, 1:2],   marginal_type = "histogram" ) p4

what: Construct network for single target gene — single_network
title: Construct network for single target gene — single_network
Construct network for single target gene — single_network
code: single_network(   matrix,   regulators,   target,   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   penalty = "L0",   r_squared_threshold = 0,   n_folds = 5,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Construct network for single target gene — single_network
text: matrix expression matrix. regulators regulator genes infer regulatory network. target target gene. cross_validation Whether use cross-validation. Default FALSE. seed random seed cross-validation. Default 1. penalty type regularization, default "L0". can take either one following choices: "L0", "L0L1", "L0L2". high-dimensional sparse data, "L0L2" effective. r_squared_threshold Threshold \(R^2\) coefficient. Default 0. n_folds number folds cross-validation. Default 5. verbose Whether print progress messages. Default TRUE. ... Parameters methods.

title: Construct network for single target gene — single_network
text: data frame single target gene network. data frame three columns: regulator, target, weight.

title: Construct network for single target gene — single_network
code: data(example_matrix) head(   single_network(     example_matrix,     regulators = colnames(example_matrix),     target = "g1"   ) ) #>   regulator target       weight #> 1       g10     g1  0.009932787 #> 2       g11     g1  0.010286958 #> 3       g12     g1  0.017584462 #> 4       g13     g1 -0.002483363 #> 5       g14     g1 -0.021346832 #> 6       g15     g1  0.027390264 head(   single_network(     example_matrix,     regulators = colnames(example_matrix),     target = "g1",     cross_validation = TRUE   ) ) #>   regulator target       weight #> 1       g10     g1  0.009932787 #> 2       g11     g1  0.010286958 #> 3       g12     g1  0.017584462 #> 4       g13     g1 -0.002483363 #> 5       g14     g1 -0.021346832 #> 6       g15     g1  0.027390264  single_network(   example_matrix,   regulators = c("g1", "g2", "g3"),   target = "g1" ) #>   regulator target     weight #> 1        g2     g1  0.9876086 #> 2        g3     g1 -0.1569370 single_network(   example_matrix,   regulators = c("g1", "g2"),   target = "g1" ) #> ! [2025-10-15 10:37:40] Less than 2 regulators found while modeling: g1 #> NULL

title: Subsampling function — subsampling
text: function subsamples matrix using either random sampling meta cells method.

title: Subsampling function — subsampling
code: subsampling(   matrix,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   seed = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Subsampling function — subsampling
text: matrix input matrix subsampled. subsampling_method method use subsampling. Options "sample", "pseudobulk" "meta_cells". subsampling_ratio percent samples used fit_srm. Default 1. seed random seed cross-validation. Default 1. verbose Whether print progress messages. Default TRUE. ... Parameters methods.

title: Subsampling function — subsampling
code: data(example_matrix) data("example_ground_truth") subsample_matrix <- subsampling(   example_matrix,   subsampling_ratio = 0.5 ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:40] Subsample matrix generated, dimensions: 2500 cells by 18 genes subsample_matrix_2 <- subsampling(   example_matrix,   subsampling_method = "meta_cells",   subsampling_ratio = 0.5,   fast_pca = FALSE ) #> ! [2025-10-15 10:37:40] Number of PCs of PCA result is less than the desired number, using all PCs. #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:41] Subsample matrix generated, dimensions: 2500 cells by 18 genes subsample_matrix_3 <- subsampling(   example_matrix,   subsampling_method = "pseudobulk",   subsampling_ratio = 0.5 ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:41] Subsample matrix generated, dimensions: 2500 cells by 18 genes  calculate_metrics(   inferCSN(example_matrix),   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:41] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:41] Checking input title: Weight sift — weight_sift
text: Remove edges smaller weights reverse direction.

title: Weight sift — weight_sift
code: weight_sift(table)

title: Weight sift — weight_sift
code: data(example_matrix) network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:46] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ◌ [2025-10-15 10:37:46] Checking input parameters... #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:46] Using `L0` sparse regression model #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:46] Using 1 core #> ℹ [2025-10-15 10:37:46] Building results #> ✔ [2025-10-15 10:37:46] Run done. weight_sift(network_table) |> head() #>   regulator target     weight #> 1       g18     g1 -0.9223177 #> 2       g17    g18  0.8770468 #> 3        g4     g3  0.8103230 #> 4       g16    g15  0.7659245 #> 5       g17    g16  0.7558764 #> 6       g12    g11  0.7444053
